input:
Paragraph: The thinner the wire, the more resistance it offers.
 Question: Shane wants to get the least resistance out of his wire for his computer, so he gets a wire that is 
 Choices: A)thicker 
B)thinner

Paragraph: As the population increases, the food supply, or the supply of another necessary resource, may decrease.
 Question: When we have one bag of dog food and we get rid of two dogs we will run out of food 
 Choices: A)slower 
B)faster

Paragraph: On a hot day, an endotherm may give off more heat by increasing blood flow to the surface of the body.
 Question: Karen is feeling very cool, and starts to chill. Her blood flow is decreased, likely because the day is 
 Choices: A)hot 
B)cold

Paragraph: The farther apart you move your hands, the stronger the force of the rubber band pulling your hands together.
 Question: Linnie played with a rubber band by pulling at it with her hands. The less she pulled it apart, the _____ the force. 
 Choices: A)weaker 
B)stronger

Paragraph: Inhaling, or breathing in, increases the size of the chest, which decreases air pressure inside the lungs.
 Question: If Mona is done with a race and her chest contracts, what happens to the amount of air pressure in her lungs? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Water also gets colder as you go deeper.
 Question: As a diver goes into shallow water, the water gets 
 Choices: A)warmer 
B)colder.

Paragraph: Bigger stars produce more energy, so their surfaces are hotter.
 Question: Jan is comparing stars, specifically a small star and the larger Sun. Given the size of each, Jan can tell that the Sun puts out heat that is 
 Choices: A)lesser 
B)greater

Paragraph: The farther apart you move your hands, the stronger the force of the rubber band pulling your hands together.
 Question: Alan has a rubber band on his hands. He pushes his hands together and the rubber bands force 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Water becomes more dense when it is colder and when it has more salt.
 Question: When water freezes into ice it becomes 
 Choices: A)less dense. 
B)more dense

Paragraph: The more similar the DNA molecules of different species are, the closer the relationship is likely to be.
 Question: When we look at monkeys and humans they have a little matching DNA meaning they are. 
 Choices: A)similar 
B)very different

Paragraph: More pollutants mean poorer air quality.
 Question: When a river gets emptied of a lot of waste chemicals it becomes 
 Choices: A)cleaner 
B)dirtier

Paragraph: The thinner the wire, the more resistance it offers.
 Question: Robin is using aluminum foil to make small cylinders. A foil cylinder of diameter 10cm likely has _____ resistance than a foil cylinder of diameter 1cm. 
 Choices: A)greater 
B)less

Paragraph: More advanced farming practices allowed a single farmer to grow food for many more people.
 Question: Farmer Bill got an older machine to sift his wheat. This machine causes him to grow _____ food. 
 Choices: A)more 
B)less

Paragraph: For a given medium, sound has a slower speed at lower temperatures.
 Question: Greta yells across the canyon in the cool morning and again in the hot afternoon. The sound likely traveled _____ in the morning. 
 Choices: A)slower 
B)not as slow

Paragraph: As the population increases, the food supply, or the supply of another necessary resource, may decrease.
 Question: Jennifer noticed there were fewer and fewer bunny rabbits in the forest behind her house eating the berries that she used to make her summer pies. As the population of the bunnies decreases will the berries be 
 Choices: A)Fewer? 
B)More?

Paragraph: In the mesosphere, temperature decreases as altitude increases.
 Question: If a person sank lower within the mesosphere, would the temperature 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: The upper rock layers are much younger.
 Question: Tom was digging in his backyard one day, after two inches he picked up an oval shaped rock. Tom kept digging and after twelve inches he picked up a square shaped rock, which rock was older? 
 Choices: A)The Oval Shaped Rock 
B)The Square Shaped Rock

Paragraph: In an inverse relationship, when one variable increases, the other variable decreases.
 Question: Dan does not want lunch, and Dan has some money. If he does not get a lunch, Dan's money will 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: So more water is displaced by a bigger body than a smaller one.
 Question: Fred fills two buckets with the same amount of water. He puts a melon in one bucket and an orange in the other. In which bucket will the water rise the least? 
 Choices: A)the one with the orange 
B)the one with the melon

Paragraph: The particles in matter are always moving. The more energy they have, the faster they move.
 Question: When a child has a little energy they will move around 
 Choices: A)slower 
B)faster

Paragraph: In the mesosphere, temperature decreases as altitude increases.
 Question: When we get lower in the air what happens to the temperature? 
 Choices: A)goes up 
B)goes down

Paragraph: The more branching there is in isomers, the lower the boiling and melting points are.
 Question: An isomer with less branching than another will have a _____ melting point. 
 Choices: A)higher 
B)lower

Paragraph: Larger alkenes have lower boiling and melting points.
 Question: Mark is boiling alkenes and wants to see which will boil last; the larger ones or the smaller ones. The alkenes that will boil last are the ones that are 
 Choices: A)smaller 
B)larger

Paragraph: Air in the troposphere is warmer closer to Earths surface.
 Question: When you are driving down a mountain you will notice the temperature 
 Choices: A)decreases 
B)increases

Paragraph: The glaciers on Earth are getting smaller and smaller as Earths temperature rises.
 Question: Eric noticed a glacier outside his boat expanding over time. The Earth's temperature is likely 
 Choices: A)decreasing 
B)increasing

Paragraph: The density of the atmosphere decreases with an increase in the height above sea level (altitude).
 Question: If Milo is hiking down a mountain and taking atmospheric density readings, what will happen to the readings as he gets closer to the top of the mountain? 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: Different types of rocks weather at different rates. More resistant types of rocks will remain longer.
 Question: When Dan went to the beach, he found rocks that had not been eroded. Some rocks were quite weathered though, so those must have a resistance that is 
 Choices: A)higher 
B)lower

Paragraph: The more an elastic object is stretched or compressed, the greater its elastic potential energy is.
 Question: What will happen to the amount of elastic potential energy in Jim's rubber band if he expands it? 
 Choices: A)more potential energy 
B)less potential energy

Paragraph: When your brain senses that your body temperature is increasing, it sends messages to the blood vessels in the skin to increase in diameter.
 Question: A person with a high fever will have _____ of the blood vessels in the skin. 
 Choices: A)narrowing 
B)widening

Paragraph: Natural selection is the process by which living things with beneficial traits produce more offspring, so their traits become more common over time.
 Question: If an animal is able to eat food more difficult is it more or less likely to reproduce? 
 Choices: A)more 
B)less

Paragraph: In the mesosphere, temperature decreases as altitude increases.
 Question: Milo is flying a rocket in the mesosphere. If he decreases his altitude, what happens to the temperature? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Inhaling, or breathing in, increases the size of the chest, which decreases air pressure inside the lungs.
 Question: Air pressure inside the lungs will _____ when one exhales out deeply. 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: Lower rock layers were laid down earlier, so they are assumed to contain older fossils.
 Question: As we dig shallower into rocks they get 
 Choices: A)younger 
B)older

Paragraph: In erosion, the higher the elevation, the farther the stream is from where it will reach base level and the more cutting it has to do.
 Question: If Milo is observing a stream at a low elevation and he follows the stream up to a lower elevation, what happens to the amount of cutting the stream has to do when eroding the stream bed beneath it? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Better farming techniques and machines increased the food supply and the distribution of food.
 Question: When people figured out how to lessen food the levels of food in the world 
 Choices: A)increased 
B)decreased

Paragraph: The farther the object is stretched or compressed, the greater its elastic potential energy is.
 Question: Decker pulls some taffy as far as he can then lets it contract. The elastic potential energy of the candy would 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: The glaciers on Earth are getting smaller and smaller as Earths temperature rises.
 Question: If Mona is measuring the size of a glacier at the North Pole and she notices that it has been getting larger over the years, what can she conclude about the Earth's temperature? 
 Choices: A)decreasing 
B)increasing

Paragraph: Smaller tributary glaciers, like tributary streams, flow into the main glacier in their own shallower U-shaped valleys.
 Question: If Milo is out exploring and he comes across two glaciers, each with their own u-shaped valley, will the smaller or larger glacier have a larger u-shaped valley? 
 Choices: A)larger glacier 
B)smaller glacier

Paragraph: The louder the sounds are, the less exposure is needed to cause hearing loss.
 Question: If you are at a loud rock concert what will not happen to your hearing? 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: With a higher the concentration of hydrogen ions, a solution is more acidic and has a lower pH.
 Question: A small container that has 100 hydrogen ions is sitting near a larger container that has 2 hydrogen ions. The solution in the larger container is 
 Choices: A)more acidic 
B)less acidic.

Paragraph: When we add resistors in parallel to each other the total resistance decreases and the current increases.
 Question: Dean turns the current down a lot, expecting that the resistance will 
 Choices: A)shrink 
B)grow

Paragraph: Thicker wires offer less resistance.
 Question: Which likely offers the greatest amount of resistance? 
 Choices: A)a boat towing cable 
B)a telephone cable

Paragraph: A: As the car approaches the radar gun, the reflected microwaves get bunched up in front of the car. Therefore, the waves the receiver detects have a higher frequency than they would if they were being reflected from a stationary object. The faster the car is moving, the greater the increase in the frequency of the waves.
 Question: The cop shot the radar gun at the super slow car, which _____ the waves. 
 Choices: A)increased 
B)decreased

Paragraph: As the liquid particles lose energy, their movement slows down even more. As their movements become slower and slower, the attractive forces between become stronger.
 Question: When we are increasing energy used while running what will happen? 
 Choices: A)speed up 
B)slow down

Paragraph: We also saw that adding resistors to a series circuit increases the total resistance of the circuit, causing the current to decrease.
 Question: Jim loves to build circuits. One day he builds a circuit that has less resistors then any other circuit he has built. Since the circuit has less resistors the amount of current in the circuit is 
 Choices: A)reduced 
B)increased

Paragraph: However, the melanocytes of people with darker skin produce more melanin.
 Question: Since Kim has less melanin than Jennifer, when they lay out in the sun Jennifer's skin is _____ than Kim's. 
 Choices: A)darker 
B)lighter

Paragraph: The more acidic a solution is, the closer its pH value will be to 0
 Question: When a pH number is very high we say the item is: 
 Choices: A)basic 
B)acidic

Paragraph: In general, the farther away from the Sun, the greater the distance from one planets orbit to the next.
 Question: If Mona is in space comparing the distance of certain planets from the Sun and she notices that Neptune is closer than Pluto, which planet will have the shorter orbit? 
 Choices: A)Pluto 
B)Neptune

Paragraph: Lower temperature and higher salinity yield the densest water.
 Question: When water starts to freeze it becomes 
 Choices: A)more dense 
B)less dense

Paragraph: Sea level rises if an increase in seafloor spreading rate buoys up the ocean crust, causing the ocean basin to become smaller.
 Question: John was looking at the ocean level data on his computer. He noticed that as the seafloor spreading rate increases, the level of the sea 
 Choices: A)Decreases 
B)Increases

Paragraph: If the gas is cooled, the particles will move more slowly, because they will have less energy.
 Question: John is playing around with different temperature settings on his bunsen burner. If he heats up a gas in the burner and then lets the gas cool down, what would happen to the gas particles as the temperature got lower? 
 Choices: A)they would slow down 
B)they would speed up

Paragraph: Its harder to overcome friction between heavier objects and the floor than it is between lighter objects and the floor.
 Question: If Milo is sliding a basketball and a baseball across the floor and the baseball is the heavier of the two objects, which object will experience more friction? 
 Choices: A)basketball 
B)baseball

Paragraph: The planets further from the Sun will have bigger orbits, and therefore take longer to revolve around the Sun.
 Question: A planet with a long orbit will take _____ time to revolve around the Sun than one with a small orbit. 
 Choices: A)more 
B)less

Paragraph: Increasing the number of resistors in a series circuit increases the overall resistance of the circuit.
 Question: If Milo is building a new circuit and he increases the number of resistors in a series on that circuit, what happens to the overall resistance of the circuit? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Longer wavelength electromagnetic waves have lower frequencies, and shorter wavelength waves have higher frequencies.
 Question: John was testing a radio wave and had an interesting finding. The shorter the wavelength was, the frequency became 
 Choices: A)Higher 
B)Lower

Paragraph: For a given medium, sound waves travel more slowly at lower temperatures.
 Question: John was watching the sound waves in his electronic monitor when he noticed something. The speed of the sound waves was slower when the temperature was 
 Choices: A)higher 
B)lower

Paragraph: The more efficient a device is, the greater the percentage of usable energy it produces.
 Question: When a device become more efficient, its production of usable energy will go 
 Choices: A)up 
B)down

Paragraph: The smaller its mass is, the greater its acceleration for a given amount of force.
 Question: What happens to a heavy car when it has the same power as a light car? 
 Choices: A)accelerates faster 
B)accelerates slower

Paragraph: At higher temperatures, particles of reactants have more energy, so they move faster.
 Question: When observing reactants and their particles, Shane increases the temperature they're exposed to, noting that they now move 
 Choices: A)faster 
B)slower

Paragraph: A sunscreen with a higher SPF value protects the skin longer.
 Question: Allie looks for sunscreen at the store. She sees SPF 30 and SPF 100. Which likely protects her skin better? 
 Choices: A)SPF 30 
B)SPF 100

Paragraph: The more tightly packed the particles inside the material are, the more dense we say they are.
 Question: Sasha is throwing bottles into the lake. Some bottles are filled with sand, and some only have a tiny bit of sand in them. The bottles filled with sand will sink first because they are 
 Choices: A)less dense 
B)more dense

Paragraph: If there are more greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, more ultraviolet radiation will be trapped and the Earth will heat up.
 Question: If greenhouse gases in the atmosphere were to be doubled, Earth will become 
 Choices: A)cooler 
B)warmer

Paragraph: The temperature of matter increases with the added energy.
 Question: John was checking the temperature of the unit. He saw that as the temperature increased when the level of energy was 
 Choices: A)Greater 
B)Lesser

Paragraph: Larger telescopes can collect more light.
 Question: Alan saw Venus through his old telescope. He then looked through his bigger, better telescope. Venus likely appears brighter through the 
 Choices: A)smaller telescope 
B)bigger telescope

Paragraph: Richer nations use far more energy resources, especially fossil fuels, than poorer nations do.
 Question: John is from Chile. When he visited a richer country, he noticed the use of energy resources there was 
 Choices: A)more 
B)less.

Paragraph: An increase in predators, the emergence of a new disease, or the loss of habitat are just three possible problems that will decrease a population.
 Question: Lizzie visited a village where an illness wiped many people out. The population got 
 Choices: A)larger 
B)smaller

Paragraph: The surface is heated by the Sun and some of that heat radiates back into the air. This makes the temperature higher near the surface than at higher altitudes.
 Question: Paul started at the base of a mountain and climbed to its peak. The sky was clear and the sun was beating down on him all day. However, he noticed there was a clear temperature difference between the surface's temperature and the temperature at the top of the mountain peak. Where would he feel more heat? 
 Choices: A)Surface 
B)Mountain Peak

Paragraph: The faster the clicks of a Geiger counter occur, the higher the level of radiation.
 Question: A Geiger counter is clicking away, and suddenly speeds up quite a lot. The counter is telling people that the level of radiation is 
 Choices: A)lower 
B)higher

Paragraph: Decreasing air temperature increases atmospheric pressure.
 Question: Rich lives in Chicago, Illinois while Rachel lives in Sydney, Australia. Who likely experiences more atmospheric pressure in December? 
 Choices: A)Rich 
B)Rachel

Paragraph: The hotter a main sequence star is, the brighter it is.
 Question: Stars that are hotter are also 
 Choices: A)dimmer 
B)brighter

Paragraph: The hotter a main sequence star is, the brighter it is.
 Question: Stars that are colder are also 
 Choices: A)dimmer 
B)brighter

 Question: Steve noticed when looking at the series circuit that as more resistors were added the resistance 
 Choices: A)increased 
B)decreased

Paragraph: As greenhouse gases increase, changes will be more extreme.
 Question: When we have a lot of greenhouse gases in the air what happens to the temperature? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)stays the same

Paragraph: The more an elastic object is stretched or compressed, the greater its elastic potential energy is.
 Question: What will happen to the amount of elastic potential energy in Jim's rubber band if he compresses it? 
 Choices: A)more potential energy 
B)less potential energy

Paragraph: The higher the crests of a wave are, the greater the amplitude.
 Question: If Jimbo is surfing and the waves begin to crest higher, what happens to amplitude of those waves? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: Lower temperature and higher salinity yield the densest water.
 Question: If Mona is freezing a glass of water and the temperature of the water begins to decrease, what happens to the density of that water? 
 Choices: A)increases 
B)decreases

Paragraph: The louder the sounds are, the less exposure is needed to cause hearing loss.
 Question: Tina is at a loud concert. She is _____ susceptible to hearing loss as she gets closer to the speakers. 
 Choices: A)more 
B)less

 Question: Kathy did some experiments on two different alkanes and one of the alkanes had twice as many carbon atoms than the other. She would notice that which alkane would require a higher temperature to melt 
 Choices: A)alkane with fewer carbon atoms 
B)alkane with more carbon atoms?

Paragraph: With a higher the concentration of hydrogen ions, a solution is more acidic and has a lower pH.
 Question: James wants to create a solution that is more acidic than others, so his concentration of hydrogen ions will be 
 Choices: A)higher 
B)lower

Paragraph: As more resistors are added in parallel, the total current strength increases.
 Question: Mike adds more and more resistors into his parallel circuit, which causes the total current strength to 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: Developing nations will also increase demands on natural resources as they build more factories.
 Question: When a country starts manufacturing things they need to have 
 Choices: A)less resources 
B)more resources

Paragraph: When a person exercises regularly, and is fit, the heart undergoes certain long-term adaptations. The heart muscle gets stronger, and expels more blood with each contraction.
 Question: Rich works out every day. Paul does not work out at all. Whose heart expels more blood per contraction, resulting in lower BPM? 
 Choices: A)Rich 
B)Paul

Paragraph: If salt is added to a volume of water, there are more molecules in the same volume, so the water is denser.
 Question: Will adds salt to the pot of water. The water's volume is now 
 Choices: A)less dense 
B)denser

Paragraph: Natural selection is the process by which living things with beneficial traits produce more offspring, so their traits become more common over time.
 Question: If the number of offspring of an species is increased, what happens to the number of traits they have in common with one another? 
 Choices: A)they will have more traits in common 
B)they will have less traits in common
target: they will have more traits in common

 Choices: A)moist 
B)dry

 Question: Jim is performing experiments in his lab. If he applies more heat to gas inside of a beaker, what happens to the gas particles? 
 Choices: A)move faster 
B)move slower

Paragraph: The trade-off when the threads are closer together, is that more turns of the screw or bolt are needed to do the job because the distance over which the input force must be applied is greater.
 Question: If Jim is screwing in two bolts and the first one has threads that are close together while the second one has threads that are far apart, which one must he apply greater force to? 
 Choices: A)first bolt 
B)second bolt

Paragraph: The greater the objects mass, the greater the force of gravitational attraction.
 Question: When two things are small they have what level of gravitational force? 
 Choices: A)High 
B)Low

 Choices: A)high

 Choices: A)more

 Choices: A)more dense

 Choices: A)Sue 
B)Tom

 Question: Ryan wants to have better technology in the world, so do have that, he will need for the things currently being developed to be 
 Choices: A)better

 Choices: A)flat 
B)curved

Paragraph: The bigger the waves are and the more sediment they carry, the more erosion they cause.
 Question: Jimbo was sitting at the beach watching the waves. He noticed the waves were increasing in size. What does this mean for the amount of erosion that the waves will cause? 
 Choices: A)decrease 
B)increase

Paragraph: At higher concentrations, particles of reactants are crowded closer together, so they are more likely to collide and react.
 Question: As we fill a balloon with air the number of reactions in the balloon 
 Choices: A)increase 
B)decrease

Paragraph: More particles inside the container means more collisions, and more collisions mean a higher pressure.

 Choices: A)Higher

Paragraph: The farther you stretch the band, the greater the resistance is.
 Question: Jim is playing with a rubber band by stretching and releasing it. Would he feel less resistance stretching the band to 
 Choices: A)40 cm or

Paragraph: The rocket goes upwards because the hot gases shoot downwards out of the nozzle. The faster the gases go downwards, the faster the rocket goes upwards.
 Question: Boris was tasked with developing a hypersonic rocket. He built two prototypes that were identical except that they have different gas velocities out of the nozzle. Which rocket was likely the fastest? 
 Choices: A)the rocket with highest gas velocity 
B)the rocket with lowest gas velocity
target: the rocket with highest gas velocity

 Choices: A)Bob 
B)Ann

 Choices: A)the curved lens refracts more light

target: the curved lens refracts more light
